Package index

Building plot

Adding elements

All plots begin with a call to ggheatmap() or ggstack, supplying default data and aesthetic mappings, specified by aes(). You then add reordering the layout, or group the layout into panels, and add plots, layers, scales, coords with +. To save a plot to disk, use ggsave().

`+`(<Layout>,<ANY>)
Add components to Layout
`&`(<Layout>,<ANY>)
Add components to all plots
build_patchwork()
Build Layout object for rendering.

Active context

A Layout object may have multiple plots, you can choose where to add ggplot2 elements with following functions.

hmanno()
Determine the active context of heatmap layout
active()
Determine the active context of stack layout
activate()
Determine the context of subsequent manipulations

Plot Layout

A Layout object defines how to place the plots.

layout_heatmap() ggheatmap()
Put plots around a Heatmap
layout_stack() ggstack()
Put plots horizontally or vertically

Plot basics

Add plots to layout

align_gg() ggalign()
Create ggplot object in the layout
align_panel() ggpanel()
Create ggplot object in the layout panel

Setup Layout

Reordering obervations or Group into panels

align_dendro()
Dendrogram plot
align_group()
Group layout axis into panel
align_kmeans()
Group layout observations by kmeans
align_reorder()
Reorder layout observations

Extending ggplot2

New ggplot2 geoms, stats, scales, and facets

geom_draw()
Layer with Grid or Function

helpers

A handful of helpers

hclust2()
Generate Tree Structures with Hierarchical Clustering
dendrogram_data()
Dengrogram x and y coordinates
is.ggheatmap()
Reports whether x is a HeatmapLayout object
is.ggstack()
Reports whether x is a StackLayout object
